column4: Could you run boot info script as explained here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt ?
give me a second
here is the pastie of the script output  http://pastie.org/1123450
Is that really windows 95 that's installed?
no xp
sudo apt-get install mbr; sudo install-mbr /dev/sda
ok not /dev/sda2
that was the xp partition
Definitely not /dev/sda2. Installing anything from ms-sys or install-mbr to the windows partition will break things.
ah man I did that before I came to ask on irc
well let me try the correct way
You may need to follow this guide as well then: http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/bootinfoscript/index.php?title=Boot_Problems:Boot_Sector
should I get anything after the command or do i need to turn on a verbose option
If there is no output then it completed without error.
so that is good ok
let me see what happens when I reboot I am on another laptop for irc
well that what different now I got to lines when I boot mbr, mbr 123FA
Try following http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/bootinfoscript/index.php?title=Boot_Problems:Boot_Sector
yeah I am going to
thanks for all the help you and the other people that have helped me so far
You're welcome.
I will get back to you on how testdisk worked in a bit it takes a bit for the laptop to boot up the live cd
the irony of this all is that testdisk had a thing that rewrites a windows mbr and it is really easy to use and I could not have made that mistake
